result.execSummary:
The defendant Rontrell M Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: $418.00 to be paid to Emilee W., JOINT AND SEVERAL with Brian Williams 15CF516

Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to any other sentence


Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF ES TO BE DETERMINED BY THE DEPT. OF CORRECTIONS, but to include:
- Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens. No positive results.
- No illegal drugs.
- No controlled substances without valid prescription.
- No Contact with drug community.
- No Contact with the victims: Emilee W. and Katherine R. and the co-actor Brian Williams.
- Seek/maintain full time employment.
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

supervisions.notes: Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done. Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Request for Modification, filed and signed by the Court.  The defendant's request for modification of his eligibility date for WSAP is denied.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request to modify date for WSAP eligibility.

Defendant Rontrell M Washington in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Defendant Rontrell M Washington in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 7 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 4 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victims:  Emilee W. and Katherine R. and the co-actor Brian Williams.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $418.00 to be paid to Emilee W., joint and several with Brian Williams 15CF516.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
filed.
ORDER TO PRODUCE

Defendant Rontrell M Washington in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Defendant Rontrell M Washington in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Defendant remanded pending sentencing.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Produce for Final Pre-Trial on August 12, 2015 @ 8:30 am received and filed

Attorney John P Carlson in court, defendant Rontrell M Washington not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests jury trial.    Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 26.  Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney John P Carlson in court, defendant Rontrell M Washington not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Projected guilty plea hearing.  Defense counsel requests new date.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
